page.title: 15HEALTH CARE
page.content: There are eight doctors. One has 2,500 patients with approximately 115 visits to surgery each week, mainly babies and old people. His first working hour is spent in dealing with the post, followed by three hours consultation. An hour after lunch is devoted to home visitation, followed by an hour's work on hospital reports and correspondence. Two hours are then spent at evening surgery. Mondays and Fridays are the busiest days. In winter, most common complaints are respiratory diseases and in summer throat infections. The most common illness prevalent is that affecting the blood vessels. Illnesses which spread the most are measles, flu, respiratory and colds.
